revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: reed: li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 3. root (used as a spice, Saussurea Lappa): li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 5. Cassia (cinnamomum iners): li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 3. xylokasia (an inferior kind of cassia): li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 4. Cyclamen graecum: li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 1. ... Storax (Styrax officinalis): li(trae) 2, ke(ratia) 3. Saffron (crocus sativus): (unciae) 3, ke(ratia) 12 unciae 3 1/2. Storax (styrax officinallis): (unciae) 8, ke(ratia) 4. Asphlalt (bitumen): li(trae) 3, ke(ration) 1. Dust: li(trae) 3, ke(ratia) 4. onycha (an aromatic substance): li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 2 1/2. Mastich (pistacia lentiscus or atractylis gummifera): li(tra) 1, ke(ration) 1. Balsam-wood: li(tra) 1, ke(ration) 1/2. balsam: (unciae) 2, ke(ratia) 12. Sediment: li(trae) 2, ke(ratia) 3. Francincense: li(tra) 1, ke(ratia) 3. Hemp (cannavis sativa): ke(ratia) 4. Epithymon (a parasitic plant growing on thyme): gr(ammata) 12, ke(ration) a. [[sigkiper(is) ke(ratia) 20]]. Laserwort (ferula tingitana): gr(ammata) 12, ke(ramia) 2.;[[ajowan (carum copticum): gr(ammata)]]. Parsley (petroselinum sativum): gr(ammata) 12, ke(ration) 1/2;(here translated by NL)
